thread.title: Bellows Falls Union HIgh School field hockey goes to 9-2-2
thread.title_full: Bellows Falls Union HIgh School field hockey goes to 9-2-2

author: Reformer Staff
title: Bellows Falls Union HIgh School field hockey goes to 9-2-2
text:
Bellows Falls Union HIgh School field hockey goes to 9-2-2 
Reformer Staff Posted: 10/15/2015 08:05:31 PM EDT Updated: 10/16/2015 05:45:09 AM EDT 
WESTMINSTER â€” The Bellows Falls Union High School varsity field hockey team improved to 9-2-2 with recent victories over Woodstock and MAU. 
On Thursday, Abbe Cravinho tallied eight minutes in and the Terriers held on for a 1-0 victory. Goalie Brigid Hodsden made three stops for the shutout. 
Reagan Baldasaro was the hero on Wednesday, burying a shot with 3:20 left in overtime to give the Terriers a 1-0 decision over Woodstock. The Wasps held a 16-3 advantage in penalty corners, but failed to get anything by Hodsden (2 saves). 
Bellows Falls will host Hartford on Saturday and the Terriers will honor their seniors. Boys Soccer 
TWIN VALLEY 3, WINDSOR 0 
WILMINGTON >> Nick Nilsen scored once and also had a couple of assists during Senior Night for the 12-1 Wildcats, who are the two-time defending Division 4 champions. 
Logan Park and Justin Hicks also split the posts. Hicks assisted on Nilsen's burial, which put the home team ahead for good. 
Kyle Murdock made one save to earn the shutout. Advertisement
